intro: Eriophorella, commonly known as the spiny eriophorella, is a small, flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of grass species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
